text: Erigeron lachnocephalus is an Asian species of flowering plants in the daisy family. It grows on rocky slopes and in alpine meadows at high elevations in Xinjiang, Kazakhstan, and Uzbekistan. Erigeron lachnocephalus is a perennial, clump-forming herb up to 15 cm (6 inches) tall, forming a branching, woody caudex. Its flower heads have pink or lilac ray florets surrounding yellow disc florets.Flora of China, Erigeron lachnocephalus Botschantzev, 1959. 毛苞飞蓬 mao bao fei peng Botschantzev, Victor Petrovič 1959. Flora Unionis Rerumpublicarum Sovieticarum Socialisticarum 25: 230 ==References== lachnocephalus Category:Flora of Asia Category:Plants described in 1959
title: Erigeron lachnocephalus
